title: Discover the Innate Beauty of Leh and Ladakh with IRCTC Leh Trip (Irctc Tourism)
text: By Irctc Tourism Jul 18, 2015 Better known as the capital city of the Himalayan region, Ladakh, Leh is recognized as the second largest district of the Indian subcontinent and it delivers an exhilarating experience to its visitors. This place is endowed with enormous beauty and natural characteristics that hardly any place in India possesses.This place is acclaimed for isolated Himalayan peaks and mountainous desert stretching from one peak to another. Apart from the innate beauty, this region is gifted with monasteries, well-planned city and adventure sporting like trekking, river rafting and rock climbing. Moreover, the snow covered peaks, stunning mountain flower and deep valley with running streams are the other indispensable quality that this place is made up of.In short, exploring this place and its beauty will not discourage your expectation rather, mesmerize you with the extraordinary beauty that no other place could ever offer you all at once. So, with a 4 nights and 5days tour organized by IRCTC, one can visit this beautiful Himalayan kingdom and the remarkable tourist destinations present in this region.The IRCTC Leh Trip primarily targets Leh and Ladakh regions of the Indian subcontinent where the chief mode of travelling is the flight from the Delhi airport and the trip commences from Leh airport. This is a cost-effective package where interested tourists can get the glimpse of high mountain passes, Pangong Lakes and renowned monasteries present here. Alongside, the world's highest motorable roads and Kahrdungla pass are the other attractions of this trip.The 4 nights and 5 day trip will provide you the monastery visitation that includes Palace, Shanti Stupa, Shey Palace, Thiksey, Hemis Monastery and Stok Palace Museum. Another program of the journey incorporates Pangong Lake visit through Changla Pass, which is the highest salt water lake in the world that are shared by both India and China. And at the end, the trip finishes off at Khardungla Pass, which is known as the World's highest motorable road with 18320 feet.While undertaking this journey with IRCTC, you will experience a worth remembering trip to this remarkable land and the underlining part of this tour is that you can enjoy comfortable accommodation with a delicious meal from time to time.This is the perfect time of the year to catch the awesome glimpse of Leh and Ladakh and to get pleasure and comfort during the course of the journey, there is no one other than IRCTC who will deliver you the best sight of this remote Himalayan land with utmost luxury and gratification. About the Author This article has been written by an author who is associated with IRCTC and here this article is created to endorse and promote IRCTC Leh Trip . Rating:
